myPosts.title: The Skoob trip of June 2019
myPosts.subtitle: We had fun in the KZN sun - until Clarence happened
myPosts.content:
We were four skoobs, each one with an undying will to create memories that will last the ages. We were searching for the warmer waters of the eastern coast, or looking back on it, were we running? We left behind our families, our troubles, and some of us our partners - perhaps we would never see them again.


The madmen: Alexander Ofemi on the left and Twinkle Toes on the right. Umdloti, June 28.

They were inseparable from the day they first met and you could tell the one was close by when the other switched over to an ancient French dialect only the two of them could understand. 


That's myself with Ofemi. 

He was shy around chopsticks - said that they didn't suit his hands and had to get Toes to feed him sushi from time to time, but we knew he had what it took to become the exquisite sculptor that he was destined to be. In 2022 his exhibition would reach Milan.


Miss Raine. Clarence, June 30

For many purposes she withheld her true identity from us. 

And for many reasons she withheld her feelings from the rest of the world.

But we all had a glimpse into her world as the long tar road stretched ahead of us.

I become very close with her, perhaps too close, because what I interpreted as a cozy campfire was a blazing wildfire, eager to devour what stood in its way.


Twinkle Toes at his finest.

He will be missed. Like the rising sun he brought warmness and light into our day as soon as he was in the room. I remember Ofemi's tear roll down his nose onto Toes' face and into his blood-filled mouth that evening. He'd been battling anthropogenic meningitis all his life, what started out as another evening, flooding our worries away with wine, ended with him sprawled out on the floor, gasping for breath as Ofemi held him in his arms as gently as mother would her wounded child. Through the bubbling of blood, he managed to slip his final words: 'Mo.. moo.. Mon-con-con'. And with that Ofemi close his brother's eyes and said; 'You too, my sunset'.


Skoobs to the end.
myPosts.author: Jean-Maree

myPosts.title: A little bit about Unsplash
myPosts.subtitle: I'm using Unsplash images to fill the blanks - this way I'll be focused on the rest of the blog.
myPosts.content:
Unsplash images made my life a lot easier whilst providing me project with crisp, fresh images constantly. I believe that it is worthwhile to delve into the API to reap the following benefits:

  •   - Categories: I'll be able to select exactly which kinds of images I want.

  - Responsiveness: Improved responsiveness from images.

Hopefully this way I can continue to use stock images whilst focusing on the blog.
myPosts.author: Jean-Maree

myPosts.title: Test Post
myPosts.subtitle: For you, Mom
myPosts.content:
Hello Ma,

Ek sien uit na die dag wanneer ons weer kan saam reis en wonderlikke plekke saam sien.
